intro: Odontites hispanicus var. aranensis, commonly known as the Aran rock scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees region. It is a perennial herb with a basal rosette of leaves and stems that bear small, blue to violet flowers. The plant thrives in rocky or alpine habitats, often growing in crevices and on slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense clusters. This variety is noted for its hardiness and is often found in high-altitude environments.
